required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intraoperative Assessment of Ureteral Perfusion in Women With Endometriosis
clinical_study.official_title: Intraoperative Assessment of Ureteral Perfusion Using Indocyanine Green Angiography in Women Submitted to Laparoscopic Surgery for Endometriosis

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria di Bologna Policlinico S. Orsola Malpighi

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria di Bologna Policlinico S. Orsola Malpighi

brief_summary.textblock:
Deep infiltrating endometriosis (DIE) is a severe form of endometriosis in which lesions affect retroperitoneal tissue and pelvic organs wall. It is often characterized by pain (dysmenorrhea, dysuria, dyspnea, dyspareunia, and chronic pelvic pain) and infertility, drastically impacting on women' quality of life. It is typically multifocal, involving uterosacral ligaments, the upper third of posterior vaginal wall, bowel, bladder, and ureters.
Indocyanine green (ICG) is an anionic tricarbocyanine molecule able to bind to plasma proteins into the vascular system and to become fluorescent if excited by near-infrared light (NIR). NIR-ICG imaging is used in gynecology for the intraoperative diagnosis of occult peritoneal and deep endometriosis at white light and to assess tissue perfusion and guide surgical strategy.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients with clinical and trans-vaginal / abdominal ultrasound diagnosis of deep endometriosis, undergoing surgery for the removal of endometriotic lesions are included in the study.
Ureter perfusion will be intraoperatively assessed using indocyanine green angiography.
After surgery, patients will be included in the post-operative follow-up, as usual in our clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility and safety: Clavien-Dindo Classification (from Grade I to V)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the surgery time, assessed up to 7 days after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of feasibility and safety of indocyanine green angiography in women submitted to laparoscopic surgery for endometriosis, considering complications using Clavien-Dindo Classification (from Grade I to V)

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of ureteral vascularization using indocyanine green angiography in women submitted to laparoscopic surgery for endometriosis

arm_group.description: Women undergoing laparoscopic surgery for endometriosis

intervention.description: Intravenous ICG (PULSION Medical Systems SE, Feldkirchen, Germany) will be used for the intraoperative evaluation of ureteral vascularization. Twenty-five milligrams of indocyanine green will be diluted in 10 ml of soluble water, and a bolus of 0.25 mg/Kg will be injected through a peripheral vein. During laparoscopy, a NIR camera-head (KARL STORZ Gesellschaft Mit Beschr√§nkter Haftung& Co., Tuttlingen, Germany) will be used to visualize the ureteral vascularization.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients undergoing laparoscopic surgery for endometriosis
- informed consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- known or suspected allergy to iodide
- history of active pelvic infection
- presence of intra-abdominal or pelvic malignancy
- pelvic radiation therapy
- hyperthyroidism
- liver dysfunction
- serum creatinine > 2.0 mg/dL

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria di Bologna Policlinico S. Orsola Malpighi
